Sentencas: Direct ammonia solid oxide fuel cell (DA-SOFC) is superior to low-temperature direct ammonia fuel cell using anion exchange membrane because of much improved anode reaction kinetics at elevated temperature.
Titulo: Infiltrated NiCo Alloy Nanoparticle Decorated Perovskite Oxide: A Highly Active, Stable, and Antisintering Anode for Direct-Ammonia Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, significant performance degradation due to severe sintering of conventional nickel cermet anode under operating conditions is a big challenge for realizing its practical use.
Titulo: Infiltrated NiCo Alloy Nanoparticle Decorated Perovskite Oxide: A Highly Active, Stable, and Antisintering Anode for Direct-Ammonia Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Herein, a high-performance anode based on La0.55Sr0.30TiO3-delta (LST) perovskite substrate with its surface decorated with in situ exsolved and strongly coupled NiCo alloy nanoparticles (NPs) is designed and fabricated for DA-SOFCs, exhibiting superior catalytic activity for NH3 decomposition reaction due to balanced NH3 adsorption and N-2 desorption processes.
Titulo: Infiltrated NiCo Alloy Nanoparticle Decorated Perovskite Oxide: A Highly Active, Stable, and Antisintering Anode for Direct-Ammonia Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: An electrolyte-supported single cell with infiltrated NiCo/LST on Sm0.2Ce0.8O1.9 scaffold anode delivers a maximum power density of 361 mW cm(-2) at 800 degrees C in NH3 fuel, superior to similar SOFCs with Ni or Co NP-decorated LST based anodes (161 and 98 mW cm(-2)).
Titulo: Infiltrated NiCo Alloy Nanoparticle Decorated Perovskite Oxide: A Highly Active, Stable, and Antisintering Anode for Direct-Ammonia Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the SOFC with this newly developed anode displays favorable operational stability without obvious performance degradation at 700 degrees C for a test period of approximate to 120 h, attributed to its high antisintering capability.
Titulo: Infiltrated NiCo Alloy Nanoparticle Decorated Perovskite Oxide: A Highly Active, Stable, and Antisintering Anode for Direct-Ammonia Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This study provides some strategies to develop highly active, stable, and antisintering perovskite-based nanocomposite for DA-SOFCs, facilitating the practical use of this technology.
Titulo: Infiltrated NiCo Alloy Nanoparticle Decorated Perovskite Oxide: A Highly Active, Stable, and Antisintering Anode for Direct-Ammonia Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
